verses.text: And it came to pass, when king Hezekiah heard \add it\add*, that he rent his clothes, and covered himself with sackcloth, and went \add into\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*.
And he sent Eliakim, which \add was\add* over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Esai the prophet the son of Amoz.

And they said unto him, Thus saith Hezekiah, This day \add is\add* a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and blasphemy: for the children are come to the birth, and \add there is\add* not strength to bring forth.

It may be the \sc Lord\sc* thy God will hear all the words of Rab-shakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God; and will reprove the words which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up \add thy\add* prayer for the remnant that are left.
So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.

And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye say to your master, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Be not afraid of the words which thou hast heard, \add with\add* which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.
Behold, I will send a blast upon him, and he shall hear a rumour, and shall return to his own land; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.
So Rab-shakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah: for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.
And when he heard say of Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, Behold, he is come out to fight against thee: he sent messengers again unto Hezekiah, saying,
Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Let not thy God in whom thou trustest deceive thee, saying, Jerusalem shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.
Behold, thou hast heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands, by destroying them utterly: and shalt thou be delivered?
Have the gods of the nations delivered them which my fathers have destroyed; \add as\add* Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden which \add were\add* in Thelasar?
Where \add is\add* the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, \add of\add* Hena, and Ivah?
And Hezekiah received the letter of the hand of the messengers, and read it: and Hezekiah went up \add into\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, and spread it before the \sc Lord\sc*.

And Hezekiah prayed before the \sc Lord\sc*, and said, O \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel, which dwellest \add between\add* the cherubims, thou \add art\add* the God, \add even\add* thou alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth; thou hast made heaven and earth.
\sc Lord\sc*, bow down thine ear, and hear: open, \sc Lord\sc*, thine eyes, and see: and hear the words of Sennacherib, which hath sent him to reproach the living God.
Of a truth, \sc Lord\sc*, the kings of Assyria have destroyed the nations and their lands,
and have cast their gods into the fire: for they \add were\add* no gods, but the work of men’s hands, wood and stone: therefore they have destroyed them.

Now therefore, O \sc Lord\sc* our God, I beseech thee, save \add thou\add* us out of his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that thou \add art\add* the \sc Lord\sc* God, \add even\add* thou only.
Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel, \add That\add* which thou hast prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria I have heard.

This \add is\add* the word that the \sc Lord\sc* hath spoken concerning him; The virgin the daughter of Zion hath despised thee, \add and\add* laughed thee to scorn; The daughter of Jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee.
Whom hast thou reproached and blasphemed? And against whom hast thou exalted \add thy\add* voice, And lift up thine eyes on high? \add Even\add* against the Holy One of Israel.

By thy messengers thou hast reproached the Lord, and hast said, With the multitude of my chariots I am come up \add To\add* the height of the mountains, \add to\add* the sides of Lebanon, And will cut down the tall cedar trees thereof, \add and\add* the choice fir trees thereof: And I will enter \add into\add* the lodgings of his borders, \add and into\add* the forest of his Carmel.
I have digged and drunk strange waters, And with the sole of my feet have I dried up all the rivers of besieged \add places\add*.

Hast thou not heard long ago \add how\add* I have done it, \add And\add* of ancient times that I have formed it? Now have I brought it to pass, that thou shouldest be to lay waste Fenced cities \add into\add* ruinous heaps.

Therefore their inhabitants \add were\add* of small power, They were dismayed and confounded; They were \add as\add* the grass of the field, and \add as\add* the green herb, \add As\add* the grass on the house tops, and \add as\add* corn blasted before it be grown up.
But I know thy abode, and thy going out, and thy coming in, And thy rage against me.
Because thy rage against me and thy tumult is come up into mine ears, Therefore I will put my hook in thy nose, and my bridle in thy lips, And I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.

And this \add shall be\add* a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat \add this\add* year such things as grow of themselves, And in the second year that which springeth of the same; And in the third year sow ye, and reap, And plant vineyards, and eat the fruits thereof.
And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah Shall \add yet\add* again take root downward, and bear fruit upward.
For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, And they that escape out of mount Zion: The zeal of the \sc Lord\sc* \add of hosts\add* shall do this.
Therefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not come into this city, Nor shoot an arrow there, Nor come before it \add with\add* shield, Nor cast a bank against it.
By the way that he came, \add by the same\add* shall he return, And shall not come into this city, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
For I will defend this city, to save it, For mine own sake, and for my servant David’s sake.

And it came to pass that night, that the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* went out, and smote in the camp of the Assyrians an hundred fourscore and five thousand: and when they arose early in the morning, behold, they \add were\add* all dead corpses.
So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went and returned, and dwelt at Nineveh.

And it came to pass, as he was worshipping \add in\add* the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer \add his sons\add* smote him with the sword: and they escaped \add into\add* the land of Armenia. And Esarhaddon his son reigned in his stead.
